intro: Leandra limbata, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink or red. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. Leandra limbata thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
